page.title: 03SCAWSBY PAST 1 Sarah Dillon
page.content: Here are some of the ways{Scawsby has been spelled and their date. Scalchebi(1086 - Domesday Book), Scalzbi (1147), Scousby(1226), Scauteby(1316), Scausbye(1620), Scorsby(1771), and{Scawsby}(1870). Most of the names start with 'Sca'. In the book "THE PLACE-NAMES OF THE WEST RIDING OF YORKSHIRE" by A.H.SMITH (Pt 1,1961) it says they think{Scawsby came from{Skalds-by }an Old Norse word which means {Skalds farm-stead.}The name Skalds itself means a poet. In 1536 during the Pilgrimage of Grace, Robert Aske and his men camped on{Scawsby Lees}and the army of Charles I camped there in 1641. Lees has also been spelled Leas and Leys and probably means a clearing or meadow. Henry VIII visited{Scawsby {Lees}in 1541, and was told it was one of the richest valleys in Europe.
